page.title: 09The Railway.
page.content:
The railway that joins Kirkham and Blackpool South runs through Wrea Green. Trains do not stop in the village but go on to the Halt at Moss Side. On some parts of the railway line there is only one track. A few years ago B.R. tried to close the line but the people protested so much that it was kept open. The line starts at Kirkham and makes its way through Wrea Green, Moss Side, Lytham, and St. Annes to Blackpool. It was opened 140 years ago and his been in continuous use.
During the summer 12 trains a day use the line. The price for a cheap day return from Kirkham to Blackpool is #1.60.
